definition: to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: After years of collecting, he has stored up lots of rare treasures.
sentences.chinese: 经过多年的收集，他已经秘藏了很多稀世的珍宝。

sentences.english: The police raided the house and uncovered a cache of weapons.
sentences.chinese: 警方突然搜查这幢房子，发现了秘藏的武器。

sentences.english: Think of them as children playing hide and seek, hoping and waiting to be discovered.
sentences.chinese: 将记忆看做是在捉秘藏希望等待被发现的孩子。

sentences.english: Beijing is a city of hidden treasures.
sentences.chinese: 北京是一座富有秘藏的城市。

definition: to hand down secret knowledge from generation to generation within a school or family etc
precious mineral deposits/hidden treasure/(fig.) treasure/(Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law
a rare treasure/sth priceless and unique
treasure-house/treasury/treasure-trove (often fig., book of treasured wisdom)
surviving section of a classic work/remaining chapters (while reading a book)
the distant past/ancient times/antiquity/early historical times
